meanings.definition: A thing that someone believes to be real but that exists only in their imagination.
meanings.sent1: The unicorn in the story was just a figment of the author's imagination.
meanings.sent2: She knew the monster under her bed was just a figment of her imagination.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog was a funny figment in the children's book.
meanings.sent4: The dream of becoming a famous singer was a figment that kept her motivated.
meanings.sent5: The figment of a magical world painted a vivid picture in her mind.

meanings.sent1: The conspiracy theory was a figment created to deceive the public.
meanings.sent2: The legend of the haunted house was just a figment passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The figment of a secret treasure map led them on a wild adventure.
meanings.sent4: The idea of time travel was a figment that captured the imagination of many.
meanings.sent5: The figment of a parallel universe sparked endless debates among scientists.
